Action.TextAuraExpression: Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.

Trigger.Name: Enter Life (At least one <=30)
Trigger.RegularExpression: You gain the effect of Dive Ready.

Action.TextAuraExpression: Use Mirage Dive then Gierskogul to enter Life of the Dragon.
Do not delay Life of the Dragon if EITHER Lance Charge OR Dragon Sight have less than 30s recast.

Trigger.Name: Mirage Save
Trigger.RegularExpression: You gain the effect of Dive Ready.

Action.TextAuraExpression: Use Geirskogul. Do not use Mirage Dive at maximum gaze.
If your Geirskogul is on cooldown, don't worry, your Mirage Dive is stored for 15s.

Trigger.Name: Enter Life (Both > 60)
Trigger.RegularExpression: You gain the effect of Dive Ready.

Action.TextAuraExpression: Use Mirage Dive then Gierskogul to enter Life of the Dragon.
Do not delay Life of the Dragon if BOTH Lance Charge AND Dragon Sight have more than 60s recast.

Trigger.Name: Delay Life (At least one <60, Both >30)
Trigger.RegularExpression: You gain the effect of Dive Ready.

Action.TextAuraExpression: Use Geirskogul then Mirage Dive, even though Mirage Dive will maximize the gaze.
If the recast of Lance Charge and Dragon Sight are both less than 60s but both more than 30s
you should delay Life of the Dragon so it can eventually benifit from either's effects.
Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
Dragoon's core relies on the gaze of the first brood and it's
synergy with two powerful abilities, Lance Charge and Dragon Sight.
It is difficult to emphasize just how important using Lance Charge,
Dragon Sight and High Jump on cooldown is to this core.
For now, enter Blood of the Dragon and alternate between the Chaos Thrust and
Full Thrust combos while weaving Lance Charge, Dragon Sight and High Jump.
I will assist you along the way.
When satisfied enter "/rotationguide" for advanced topics.
Now that you understand Dragoon's core abilities and gaze system
you must learn it's opener and when to enter Life of the Dragon.
Successfully executing the standard opener will make the rest of your rotation effortless,
as long as you use Lance Charge, Dragon Sight and High Jump on cooldown of course.
Complete this standard opener and train continuously for at least 7 minutes.
explain only what is absolutely necessary to become a proficient (Job).
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
I willl assist you along they way.
When satisfied enter "/endguide" to complete this Job Guide.
Admirable effort.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
There are two pillars to Dragoon;
Use Jump, Lance Charge and Dragon Sight on cooldown.
Enter Life of the Dragon when you can land at least one
Lance Charge or Dragon Sight enhanced Nostrand and Stardiver.
Dragoon may seem complicated at first but there are grand gaps between critical
decisions. With practice, it can be one of the most relaxing Jobs in Eorzea.
Farewell Dragoon. Do not give up.
Visit: https://thebalanceffxiv.com/ for the best guides the community has to offer.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
Not bad Dragoon!

Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
Monk's core consists solely of it's weaponskills and their status effects.
Bootshine will always crit when under the effect of Leaden Fist, granted by Dragon Kick,
True Strike is more potent than Twin Snakes when under it's damage increasing effect and
Snap Punch is more valuable than Demolish on a target that's already inflicted with Demolish.
Simply put, use Bootshine, True Strike or Snap Punch unless the effect of
Dragon Kick, Twin Snakes or Demolish have, or are about to end respectively.
Snap Punch is more valuable than Demolish on a target that's already inflicted by Demolish.
Sounds more complicated than it is, enter Fist of Fire and begin attacking.
Snap Punch is more valuable than Demolish on a target that's already inflicted by Demolish.

Monk's opener is unique as it uses a burst ability for resources and status effects.
Complete the Perfect Balance opener and keep training for at least 90s.

Monk is deceptively difficult but boils down to using your 90s abilities together
and looping (Dragon\Bootshine), (Twin\True) and (Demolish\Snap\Snap) indefinitely.
Speed and consistency are your only barriers to success, simple
barriers to overcome through practice and muscle memory alone.
So long Monk. Don't give up.

abilities under it's effect as possible, along with light Huton management.

Samura's core consists of maintaining the Shinpu, Jinpu and
Higanbana status effects while executing as many Midares as possible.
Shinpu reduces cast and recast time, Jinpu increases all damage and
Higanbana does potent damage over time. It is also common to enhace
every Higanbana, Midare or Tenka Goka with Hissatsu: Kaiten.
For now, Repeat the Kasha, Gekko and Yukikaze combos for at least 70s.

to Meikyo Shisui and Tsubame providing both a helpful clock and deadline respectively.

In order to create a 60s Tsubame loop, we need to insert 5 seconds of filler into our
rotation to make up the difference in recast between Meikyo Shisui (55s) and Tsubame (60s).
In this example, we will intuitively use Meikyo's availability as the cue for our filler detour.

Good choice. I'll refresh you on the basics.
Red Mage's core consist of gaining and balancing white
and black mana then spending it on melee attacks.
Gaining mana is straight forward but procs, intentional or random, make balancing mana cerebral,
since having one type of mana exceed the other by more than 30 will cripple gain of the lesser.
Your goal is to have enough white and black mana (80|80) to land a combo'd
Enchanted Redoublement and unlock your most potent abilities, Verholy, Verflare and Scorch.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.
For now lets focus on mana management, specifically when you
should use each cast in your arsenal and the Redoublement combo.
Dualcast is gained after any cast that is not instant yet allows you to instantly cast another spell.
Since we have no means of gaining Dualcast without attacking, begin by casting Jolt.
I will assist you along the way.
When satisfied enter "/rotationguide" for advanced topics.
Follow my lead and I'll explain as you progress.

Red Mage is deceptively simple but there is nuance in optimal performance.
Using Acceleration and Manafication on recast is key. Do not wait for ideal
conditions to use these abilities but instead create ideal conditions for their use by
spending mana through Enchanted Reprise and the Enchanted Redoublement combo.
Farewell Red Mage. Do not give up.
